title: Sublattice Interference promotes Pair Density Wave order in Kagome Metals. (arXiv:2211.01388v1 [cond-mat.str-el])
description: Motivated by the observation of a pair density wave (PDW) in the kagome metal CsV${}_3$Sb${}_5$, we consider the fate of electrons near a p-type van Hove singularity (vHS) in the presence of local repulsive interactions. We study the effect of such interactions on Fermi surface "patches" at the vHS. We show how a feature unique to the Kagome lattice known as sublattice interference crucially affects the form of the interactions among the patches. The RG flow of such interactions results in a regime where nearest neighbor interactions exceed onsite repulsion. We identify this condition as being favorable for the formation of CDW and PDW orders. We conclude that in the weak-coupling limit, CDW order is the dominant order, whereas PDW order sets in at intermediate coupling.
